intro: Diuris callitrophila, commonly known as the pink and white diuris, is a flowering plant native to southeastern Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its striking, colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or loamy soils in heathlands and open forests. Its flowers are bilaterally symmetrical, with three petals and three sepals, and are often pink or white in color. Diuris callitrophila is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained conditions and is often found in coastal regions.
